content.p: The practice of sign language interpreting and the practice of realtime captioning are hereby declared to be learned professions, affecting public health, safety and welfare, and are subject to regulation to protect the general public from the practice of sign language interpreting and the practice of realtime captioning by unqualified persons.
As used in this chapter, unless the context otherwise requires, the words and terms defined inNRS 656A.025to656A.065, inclusive, have the meanings ascribed to them in those sections.

section.heading: ï¿½Communication Access Realtime Translationï¿½ and ï¿½realtime captioningï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Communication Access Realtime Translationï¿½ and ï¿½realtime captioningï¿½ mean the immediate, verbatim translation of the spoken word into English text using a stenographic machine or voice recognition software, and a computer and realtime captioning software.

ï¿½Community settingï¿½ means any setting that is not a primary or secondary educational setting. The term includes, without limitation, a postsecondary educational setting, a legal setting and a medical setting.
ï¿½Divisionï¿½ means the Aging and Disability Services Division of the Department of Health and Human Services.
[Replaced in revision byNRS 656A.0625.]
ï¿½Interpreterï¿½ means a person who is registered or provisionally registered with the Division to engage in the practice of sign language interpreting in this State pursuant toNRS 656A.100.
A communication with a law enforcement officer, as defined inNRS 179B.070, that relates to a criminal investigation; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A negotiation for a contract for which the estimated amount required to perform the contract is $1,000 or more; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A judicial proceeding, including, without limitation: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A grand jury proceeding; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A court proceeding; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A pretrial examination, deposition, motion and related proceedings of like character; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The proceedings of an administrative agency.

ï¿½Medical settingï¿½ means any communication between a provider of health care, as defined inNRS 629.031, and a patient or a person acting on behalf of the patient concerning the provision of health care to the patient.
ï¿½Person who is deafï¿½ means a person who is not able to process information aurally and whose primary means of communication is visual.

section.heading: ï¿½Person whose hearing is impairedï¿½ defined.

content.p: Who has a hearing deficit; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Who is able to process information aurally with or without the use of a hearing aid or any other device that enhances the ability of a person to hear; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Whose primary means of communication may be visual.
A university, college or community college within the Nevada System of Higher Education; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A postsecondary educational institution, as defined inNRS 394.099.

section.heading: ï¿½Practice of sign language interpretingï¿½ defined.

content.p: Interpreting or translating between any spoken language and American Sign Language or any other visual-gestural system of communication; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Interpreting or translating between any spoken language and an oral interpretation of the speakerï¿½s words by enunciating, repeating or rephrasing those words without using the voice to assist a person who is deaf or whose hearing is impaired in lipreading the information conveyed by the speaker; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Interpreting or translating between any spoken language and a visual representation of spoken language that: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Uses eight hand shapes to represent groups of consonants and the placement of those hand shapes in four positions around the face to indicate groups of vowel sounds; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Is used in conjunction with lipreading; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Interpreting or translating between any spoken language and a system of sign language that is based on the syntax of the English language; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The use of any of the methods of interpreting or translating set forth in subsections 1 to 5, inclusive, by a person who is deaf or whose hearing is impaired to facilitate communication between another person who is deaf or whose hearing is impaired and an interpreter, or between two or more persons who are deaf or whose hearing is impaired.

ï¿½Practice of realtime captioningï¿½ means the facilitation of communication between persons who are deaf or whose hearing is impaired and other persons through the use of Communication Access Realtime Translation.

section.heading: ï¿½Primary or secondary educational settingï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Primary or secondary educational settingï¿½ means all communication relating to participation by pupils in educational programming or any other activity provided by or through a public school, school district or private school in this State.

authorialNote.p: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ (Added to NRS by2007, 160; A2021, 1533)—(Substituted in revision for NRS 656A.029)

content.p: ï¿½Private schoolï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to it inNRS 394.103.
ï¿½Public schoolï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to it inNRS 385.007.
ï¿½Realtime captioning providerï¿½ means a person who is registered with the Division to engage in the practice of realtime captioning in this State pursuant toNRS 656A.400.

Is licensed in another state to engage in the practice of sign language interpreting or the practice of realtime captioning and who engages in the practice of sign language interpreting or the practice of realtime captioning, respectively, in this State: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
For a period of not more than 30 nonconsecutive days in a calendar year; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

By teleconference if the sign language interpreting services or realtime captioning services provided by that person are necessary because an interpreter or realtime captioning provider is unavailable to provide those services in person or by teleconference; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Engages in the practice of sign language interpreting or the practice of realtime captioning solely for meetings of religious organizations; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Engages in the practice of sign language interpreting or the practice of realtime captioning as necessary for the provision of an emergency medical or governmental service to a person who is deaf or whose hearing is impaired; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Engages occasionally in the practice of sign language interpreting in a social situation that does not require a qualified interpreter pursuant to the provisions of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990, 42 U.S.C. ï¿½ï¿½ 12101 et seq., section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, 29 U.S.C. ï¿½ 794, or the regulations adopted pursuant to those provisions.

section.heading: Registry of persons registered or provisionally registered to engage in practice of sign language interpreting or practice of realtime captioning.

content.p: Establish a registry of persons who are registered or provisionally registered with the Division to engage in the practice of sign language interpreting or the practice of realtime captioning. The registry must include, without limitation: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The name of the person and any other information prescribed by the Division; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

If the person is registered or provisionally registered to engage in the practice of sign language interpreting, each professional classification in which the person is registered or provisionally registered to practice; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Make the registry available on an Internet website maintained by the Division; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Provide a copy of the registry without charge to any person upon request.
Deposited with the State Treasurer for credit to the Account for Services for Persons With Impaired Speech or Hearing created byNRS 427A.797; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Used by the Division to pay the costs incurred by the Division in carrying out the provisions of this chapter.
The Division shall adopt regulations to carry out the provisions of this chapter.

section.heading: Application; waiver of requirements; identification of professional classification requested; registration or provisional registration; limitation on duration of provisional registration.

content.p: A person who wishes to register or provisionally register to engage in the practice of sign language interpreting in this State must submit to the Division: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Proof that the applicant has complied with the requirements for education, training, experience and credentialing required for each professional classification of the practice of sign language interpreting pursuant to this section or prescribed by a regulation of the Division pursuant toNRS 656A.110; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

If the applicant wishes to register to practice sign language interpreting in a community setting, proof that the applicant holds, in good standing, a nationally recognized sign language interpreter or transliterator certification approved by the Division; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
If the applicant wishes to provisionally register to practice sign language interpreting in a community setting, proof: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
That the applicant possesses the skills necessary to practice sign language interpreting at an intermediate level; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Of ongoing participation in a program for the professional development of interpreters and engagement with a professional mentor; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
If the applicant wishes to register to practice sign language interpreting in a primary or secondary educational setting, proof: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

That the applicant has: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ (I) Completed the Educational Interpreter Performance Assessment or holds another credential for interpreters in a primary or secondary educational setting that is approved by the Division; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ (II) Received a rating of his or her level of proficiency in providing sign language interpreting services at least at level 4.0 or its equivalent; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
If the applicant wishes to provisionally register to practice sign language interpreting in a primary or secondary educational setting, proof: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

That the applicant has: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ (I) Completed the Educational Interpreter Performance Assessment or holds another credential for interpreters in a primary or secondary educational setting that is approved by the Division; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ (II) Received a rating of his or her level of proficiency in providing sign language interpreting services at least at level 3.5 or its equivalent; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Of ongoing participation in a program for the professional development of interpreters and engagement with a professional mentor; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Any other information or evidence the Division may require to determine whether the applicant has complied with the requirements to engage in the practice of sign language interpreting. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Division may, for good cause shown, waive any requirement set forth in subsection 1. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
An applicant must identify each professional classification of the practice of sign language interpreting for which he or she requests registration or provisional registration. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Except as otherwise provided in subsection 5, the Division shall: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Register or provisionally register each applicant who complies with the applicable provisions of this section as an interpreter described in the applicable paragraph of subsection 1; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Issue to the applicant proof of registration or provisional registration. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The Division shall not issue a provisional registration for a professional classification of the practice of sign language interpreting to any person for more than a total of 5 years, including renewals.

section.heading: Regulations: Qualifications, scope of practice and ethical standards for interpreters; qualifications for professional mentors of interpreters; additional professional classifications of interpreters.

content.p: The Division shall, by regulation: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Prescribe for each professional classification of interpreters: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The level of education and professional training, experience and credentialing required to engage in the practice of sign language interpreting in that classification. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The authorized scope of practice, including, without limitation, any condition, restriction or other limitation imposed on a person who practices in that classification. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Ethical standards for persons who engage in the practice of sign language interpreting in that professional classification. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Prescribe qualifications for professional mentors of interpreters, including, without limitation, the level of education, training, experience and credentialing required to provide mentoring. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Division may adopt regulations establishing professional classifications of the practice of sign language interpreting in addition to those set forth inNRS 656A.100.
A person who wishes to engage in the practice of realtime captioning in this State must submit to the Division: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Proof that the applicant has complied with the requirements for education, training, experience and credentialing required for the practice of realtime captioning as prescribed by a regulation of the Division pursuant toNRS 656A.410; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Any other information or evidence the Division may require to determine whether the applicant has complied with the requirements to engage in the practice of realtime captioning. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Division shall register each applicant who complies with the provisions of this section and issue to the applicant proof of registration.

section.heading: Regulations: Qualifications to engage in realtime captioning; ethical standards.

content.p: Prescribe the level of education and professional training, experience and credentialing required to engage in the practice of realtime captioning. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Establish ethical standards for persons who engage in the practice of realtime captioning, including, without limitation, standards for maintaining confidential communications between a realtime captioning provider and a person who receives his or her services.

section.heading: Acts constituting cause for disciplinary action.

content.p: Engaging in behavior that is contrary to the ethical standards set forth in the regulations of the Division. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Violation by an interpreter or realtime captioning provider of any of the provisions of this chapter or of any other law of this State or of the standards and other regulations adopted thereunder. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Aiding, abetting or permitting the commission of any illegal act. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Conduct inimical to the public health, morals, welfare and safety of the people of the State of Nevada while discharging duties as an interpreter or realtime captioning provider. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Engaging in the practice of sign language interpreting or the practice of realtime captioning without the skills required to meet the communication needs of the recipient of the service. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Engaging in unprofessional conduct as defined by the Division by regulation.
If an interpreter or realtime captioning provider has committed any act set forth inNRS 656A.500, the Division may: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Impose upon the interpreter or realtime captioning provider a fine of not more than $5,000 for each violation of this chapter; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Require the interpreter or realtime captioning provider to pay restitution; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Take such other disciplinary action as the Division deems appropriate. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Division may adopt regulations setting forth a schedule of fines for the purposes of paragraph
of subsection 1. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Division shall adopt regulations setting forth a schedule of penalties for engaging in unprofessional conduct. The schedule of penalties must not exceed the penalties set forth in this section.

section.heading: Filing of complaints; procedures for investigating and resolving complaints.

content.p: A person who is dissatisfied with the services provided by a person who engages in the practice of sign language interpreting or the practice of realtime captioning or becomes aware that any one or more of the grounds for initiating disciplinary action may exist as to a person who engages in the practice of sign language interpreting or the practice of realtime captioning may file a complaint with the Division. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Division shall establish procedures for investigating and resolving a complaint filed pursuant to this section.

section.heading: Investigation of complaint; action by Division.

content.p: When a complaint is filed with the Division, it must be considered by a person designated by the Division. If it appears to the person designated by the Division that further proceedings are warranted, the person shall report the results of his or her investigation together with his or her recommendation to the Division in a manner which does not violate the right of the person charged in the complaint to due process in any later hearing on the complaint. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The Division shall promptly make a determination with respect to each complaint reported to it by the person designated by the Division and shall dismiss the complaint or proceed with disciplinary action pursuant tochapter 622Aof NRS.

section.heading: Limitations on time to file complaints.

content.p: Except as otherwise provided in subsection 2, a complaint must not be filed against an interpreter or realtime captioning provider if 2 years or more have elapsed since the occurrence of the act or omission alleged as the ground for disciplinary action. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
If the act or omission alleges fraud or misrepresentation, the complaint must be filed within 2 years after the discovery of the fraud or misrepresentation.

section.heading: Prohibited acts; penalties; action for enforcement; deposit of civil penalty; report of violation to district attorney or Attorney General.

content.p: Except as otherwise provided by specific statute, it is unlawful for a person to: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Hold himself or herself out as registered, provisionally registered, or otherwise qualified to engage in the practice of sign language interpreting in this State; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Use in connection with his or her name any title, words, letters or other designation intended to imply or designate that the person is an interpreter, ï¿½unless the person is registered or provisionally registered with the Division pursuant toNRS 656A.100. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
It is unlawful for a person to: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Hold himself or herself out as registered or otherwise qualified to engage in the practice of realtime captioning in this State; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Use in connection with his or her name any title, words, letters or other designation intended to imply or designate that he or she is a realtime captioning provider, ï¿½unless the person is registered with the Division pursuant toNRS 656A.400. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A person who violates the provisions of subsection 1 or 2: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Is guilty of a misdemeanor; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
May be assessed a civil penalty of not more than $5,000. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

An action for the enforcement of a civil penalty assessed pursuant to this section may be brought in any court of competent jurisdiction by the district attorney of the appropriate county or the Attorney General. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Any civil penalty recovered pursuant to this section must be deposited with the State Treasurer for credit to the Account for Services for Persons With Impaired Speech or Hearing created byNRS 427A.797. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Division shall report a violation of a provision of subsection 1 or 2 to the district attorney of the county in which the violation occurred or the Attorney General.
